subject: Critical Thinking
title: Opportunity Cost: What You Give Up by Choosing
description: A 60-second lesson on Opportunity Cost: What You Give Up by Choosing.

hook.text: You spend $50,000 on an MBA. The cost isn't $50,000 â€” it's $50,000 plus two years of salary you didn't earn.

buildup.text: Opportunity cost: the value of the best alternative you gave up by making a choice.

discovery.text: Every decision has a visible cost and an invisible cost. Most people only see the visible one.

twist.text: Time is the ultimate opportunity cost. Every hour spent on X is an hour not spent on Y. And you can't get hours back.

climax.text: Good decision-making requires comparing options against each other â€” not just evaluating them in isolation.

punchline.text: The real cost of anything is what you gave up to get it.

quiz.question: What is opportunity cost?
options: The price tag of a purchase
The value of the best alternative you gave up
The cost of missed opportunities in the past
